com.azure.android.storage.blob

Class StorageBlobClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.azure.android.storage.blob.StorageBlobClient

  • public class StorageBlobClient
extends java.lang.Object
    Client for Storage Blob service.

    This client is instantiated through StorageBlobClient.Builder.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  StorageBlobClient.Builder
      A builder to configure and build a StorageBlobClient.

    • Method Detail

      • newBuilder

        public StorageBlobClient.Builder newBuilder(java.lang.String storageBlobClientId)
        Creates a new StorageBlobClient.Builder with initial configuration copied from this StorageBlobClient.
        Parameters:
        storageBlobClientId - The unique ID for the new StorageBlobClient. This identifier is used to associate the StorageBlobClient with the upload and download transfers it initiates. When a transfer is reloaded from disk (e.g. after an application crash), it can only be resumed once a client with the same storageBlobClientId has been initialized.
        Returns:
        A new StorageBlobClient.Builder.

                                                        java.lang.String containerName,

                                                        java.io.File file)
        Upload the content of a file.
        Parameters:
        context - The application context.
        containerName - The container to upload the file to.
        blobName - The name of the target blob holding the uploaded file.
        file - The local file to upload.

      • upload

        public androidx.lifecycle.LiveData<TransferInfo> upload(android.content.Context context,
                                                        java.lang.String containerName,
                                                        java.lang.String blobName,
                                                        android.net.Uri contentUri)
        Upload content identified by a given URI.
        Parameters:
        context - The application context.
        containerName - The container to upload the file to.
        blobName - The name of the target blob holding the uploaded file.
        contentUri - The URI to the Content to upload, the contentUri is resolved using ContentResolver.openAssetFileDescriptor(Uri, String) with mode as "r". The supported URI schemes are: 'content://', 'file://' and 'android.resource://'.
        Returns:
        A LiveData that streams TransferInfo describing the current state of the transfer.

      • pause

        public void pause(android.content.Context context,
                  long transferId)
        Pause a transfer identified by the given transfer ID. The pause operation is a best-effort, and a transfer that is already executing may continue to transfer.

        Upon successful scheduling of the pause, any observer observing on LiveData for this transfer receives a TransferInfo event with state TransferInfo.State#USER_PAUSED.

        Parameters:
        context - The application context.
        transferId - The transfer ID identifies the transfer to pause.

      • resume

        public androidx.lifecycle.LiveData<TransferInfo> resume(android.content.Context context,
                                                        long transferId)
        Resume a paused transfer.
        Parameters:
        context - The application context
        transferId - The transfer ID identifies the transfer to resume.
        Returns:
        A LiveData that streams TransferInfo describing the current state of the transfer.

      • cancel

        public void cancel(android.content.Context context,
                   long transferId)
        Cancel a transfer identified by the given transfer ID. The cancel operation is a best-effort, and a transfer that is already executing may continue to transfer.

        Upon successful scheduling of the cancellation, any observer observing on LiveData for this transfer receives a TransferInfo event with state TransferInfo.State#CANCELLED.

        Parameters:
        context - The application context.
        transferId - The transfer ID identifies the transfer to cancel.

      • getBlobsInPageWithRestResponse

        public ContainersListBlobFlatSegmentResponse getBlobsInPageWithRestResponse(java.lang.String pageId,
                                                                            java.lang.String containerName,
                                                                            java.lang.String prefix,
                                                                            java.lang.Integer maxResults,
                                                                            java.util.List<ListBlobsIncludeItem> include,
                                                                            java.lang.Integer timeout,
                                                                            java.lang.String requestId)
        Gets a list of blobs identified by a page id in a given container.
        Parameters:
        pageId - Identifies the portion of the list to be returned.
        containerName - The container name.
        prefix - Filters the results to return only blobs whose name begins with the specified prefix.
        maxResults - Specifies the maximum number of blobs to return.
        include - Include this parameter to specify one or more datasets to include in the response.
        timeout - The timeout parameter is expressed in seconds. For more information, see <a href="https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/setting-timeouts-for-blob-service-operations">Setting Timeouts for Blob Service Operations.</a>.
        requestId - Provides a client-generated, opaque value with a 1 KB character limit that is recorded in the analytics logs when storage analytics logging is enabled.
        Returns:
        A response object containing a list of blobs.

      • getBlobPropertiesWithRestResponse

        public BlobGetPropertiesResponse getBlobPropertiesWithRestResponse(java.lang.String containerName,
                                                                   java.lang.String blobName,
                                                                   java.lang.String snapshot,
                                                                   java.lang.Integer timeout,
                                                                   java.lang.String version,
                                                                   BlobRequestConditions blobRequestConditions,
                                                                   java.lang.String requestId,
                                                                   CpkInfo cpkInfo)
        Reads a blob's metadata and properties.
        Parameters:
        containerName - The container name.
        blobName - The blob name.
        snapshot - The snapshot parameter is an opaque DateTime value that, when present, specifies the blob snapshot to retrieve. For more information on working with blob snapshots, see <a href="https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/creating-a-snapshot-of-a-blob">Creating a Snapshot of a Blob.</a>.
        timeout - The timeout parameter is expressed in seconds. For more information, see <a href="https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/setting-timeouts-for-blob-service-operations">Setting Timeouts for Blob Service Operations.</a>.
        version - Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.
        blobRequestConditions - Object that contains values which will restrict the successful operation of a variety of requests to the conditions present. These conditions are entirely optional.
        requestId - Provides a client-generated, opaque value with a 1 KB character limit that is recorded in the analytics logs when storage analytics logging is enabled.
        cpkInfo - Additional parameters for the operation.
        Returns:
        The response information returned from the server when downloading a blob.

      • rawDownload

        public okhttp3.ResponseBody rawDownload(java.lang.String containerName,
                                        java.lang.String blobName)
        Reads the entire blob.

        This method will execute a raw HTTP GET in order to download a single blob to the destination. It is **STRONGLY** recommended that you use the download(Context, String, String, File) or download(Context, String, String, Uri) method instead - that method will manage the transfer in the face of changing network conditions, and is able to transfer multiple blocks in parallel. `

        Parameters:
        containerName - The container name.
        blobName - The blob name.
        Returns:
        The response containing the blob's bytes.

      • rawDownload

        public com.azure.android.core.http.ServiceCall rawDownload(java.lang.String containerName,
                                                           java.lang.String blobName,
                                                           com.azure.android.core.http.Callback<okhttp3.ResponseBody> callback)
        Reads the entire blob.

        This method will execute a raw HTTP GET in order to download a single blob to the destination. It is **STRONGLY** recommended that you use the download(Context, String, String, File) or download(Context, String, String, Uri) method instead - that method will manage the transfer in the face of changing network conditions, and is able to transfer multiple blocks in parallel.

        Parameters:
        containerName - The container name.
        blobName - The blob name.
        callback - Callback that receives the response.
        Returns:
        The service call object, representing the request scheduled for execution.

      • rawDownloadWithRestResponse

        public BlobDownloadResponse rawDownloadWithRestResponse(java.lang.String containerName,
                                                        java.lang.String blobName,
                                                        java.lang.String snapshot,
                                                        java.lang.Integer timeout,
                                                        BlobRange range,
                                                        BlobRequestConditions blobRequestConditions,
                                                        java.lang.Boolean getRangeContentMd5,
                                                        java.lang.Boolean getRangeContentCrc64,
                                                        java.lang.String version,
                                                        java.lang.String requestId,
                                                        CpkInfo cpkInfo)
        Reads a range of bytes from a blob.

        This method will execute a raw HTTP GET in order to download a single blob to the destination. It is **STRONGLY** recommended that you use the download(Context, String, String, File) or download(Context, String, String, Uri) method instead - that method will manage the transfer in the face of changing network conditions, and is able to transfer multiple blocks in parallel.

        Parameters:
        containerName - The container name.
        blobName - The blob name.
        snapshot - The snapshot parameter is an opaque DateTime value that, when present, specifies the blob snapshot to retrieve. For more information on working with blob snapshots, see <a href="https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/creating-a-snapshot-of-a-blob">Creating a Snapshot of a Blob.</a>.
        timeout - The timeout parameter is expressed in seconds. For more information, see <a href="https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/setting-timeouts-for-blob-service-operations">Setting Timeouts for Blob Service Operations.</a>.
        range - Return only the bytes of the blob in the specified range.
        blobRequestConditions - Object that contains values which will restrict the successful operation of a variety of requests to the conditions present. These conditions are entirely optional.
        getRangeContentMd5 - When set to true and specified together with the Range, the service returns the MD5 hash for the range, as long as the range is less than or equal to 4 MB in size.
        getRangeContentCrc64 - When set to true and specified together with the Range, the service returns the CRC64 hash for the range, as long as the range is less than or equal to 4 MB in size.
        version - Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.
        requestId - Provides a client-generated, opaque value with a 1 KB character limit that is recorded in the analytics logs when storage analytics logging is enabled.
        cpkInfo - Additional parameters for the operation.
        Returns:
        The response information returned from the server when downloading a blob.

      • rawDownloadWithRestResponse

        public com.azure.android.core.http.ServiceCall rawDownloadWithRestResponse(java.lang.String containerName,
                                                                           java.lang.String blobName,
                                                                           java.lang.String snapshot,
                                                                           java.lang.Integer timeout,
                                                                           BlobRange range,
                                                                           BlobRequestConditions blobRequestConditions,
                                                                           java.lang.Boolean getRangeContentMd5,
                                                                           java.lang.Boolean getRangeContentCrc64,
                                                                           java.lang.String version,
                                                                           java.lang.String requestId,
                                                                           CpkInfo cpkInfo,
                                                                           com.azure.android.core.http.Callback<BlobDownloadResponse> callback)
        Reads a range of bytes from a blob.

        This method will execute a raw HTTP GET in order to download a single blob to the destination. It is **STRONGLY** recommended that you use the download(Context, String, String, File) or download(Context, String, String, Uri) method instead - that method will manage the transfer in the face of changing network conditions, and is able to transfer multiple blocks in parallel.

        Parameters:
        containerName - The container name.
        blobName - The blob name.
        snapshot - The snapshot parameter is an opaque DateTime value that, when present, specifies the blob snapshot to retrieve. For more information on working with blob snapshots, see <a href="https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/creating-a-snapshot-of-a-blob">Creating a Snapshot of a Blob.</a>.
        timeout - The timeout parameter is expressed in seconds. For more information, see <a href="https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/setting-timeouts-for-blob-service-operations">Setting Timeouts for Blob Service Operations.</a>.
        range - Return only the bytes of the blob in the specified range.
        blobRequestConditions - Object that contains values which will restrict the successful operation of a variety of requests to the conditions present. These conditions are entirely optional.
        getRangeContentMd5 - When set to true and specified together with the Range, the service returns the MD5 hash for the range, as long as the range is less than or equal to 4 MB in size.
        getRangeContentCrc64 - When set to true and specified together with the Range, the service returns the CRC64 hash for the range, as long as the range is less than or equal to 4 MB in size.
        version - Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.
        requestId - Provides a client-generated, opaque value with a 1 KB character limit that is recorded in the analytics logs when storage analytics logging is enabled.
        cpkInfo - Additional parameters for the operation.
        callback - Callback that receives the response.
        Returns:
        The service call object, representing the request scheduled for execution.

      • stageBlock

        public java.lang.Void stageBlock(java.lang.String containerName,
                                 java.lang.String blobName,
                                 java.lang.String base64BlockId,
                                 byte[] blockContent,
                                 byte[] contentMd5)
        Creates a new block to be committed as part of a blob.
        Parameters:
        containerName - The container name.
        blobName - The blob name.
        base64BlockId - A valid Base64 string value that identifies the block. Prior to encoding, the string must be less than or equal to 64 bytes in size. For a given blob, the length of the value specified for the base64BlockId parameter must be the same size for each block.
        blockContent - The block content in bytes.
        contentMd5 - The transactional MD5 for the body, to be validated by the service.

                                                               java.lang.String leaseId,
                                                               java.lang.String requestId,
                                                               CpkInfo cpkInfo)
        Creates a new block to be committed as part of a blob.

        containerName - The container name.
        blobName - The blob name.
        base64BlockId - A valid Base64 string value that identifies the block. Prior to encoding, the string must be less than or equal to 64 bytes in size. For a given blob, the length of the value specified for the base64BlockId parameter must be the same size for each block.
        blockContent - The block content in bytes.
        contentMd5 - The transactional MD5 for the block content, to be validated by the service.
        contentCrc64 - Specify the transactional crc64 for the block content, to be validated by the service.
        timeout - The timeout parameter is expressed in seconds. For more information, see <a href="https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/fileservices/setting-timeouts-for-blob-service-operations">Setting Timeouts for Blob Service Operations.</a>.
        leaseId - If specified, the staging only succeeds if the resource's lease is active and matches this ID.
        requestId - Provides a client-generated, opaque value with a 1 KB character limit that is recorded. in the analytics logs when storage analytics logging is enabled.
        cpkInfo - Additional parameters for the operation.
        Returns:
        The response object.

      • commitBlockList

        public BlockBlobItem commitBlockList(java.lang.String containerName,
                                     java.lang.String blobName,
                                     java.util.List<java.lang.String> base64BlockIds,
                                     boolean overwrite)
        The Commit Block List operation writes a blob by specifying the list of block IDs that make up the blob. For a block to be written as part of a blob, the block must have been successfully written to the server in a prior stageBlock(String, String, String, byte[], byte[]) operation. You can call commit Block List to update a blob by uploading only those blocks that have changed, then committing the new and existing blocks together. You can do this by specifying whether to commit a block from the committed block list or from the uncommitted block list, or to commit the most recently uploaded version of the block, whichever list it may belong to.
        Parameters:
        containerName - The container name.
        blobName - The blob name.
        base64BlockIds - The block IDs.
        overwrite - Indicate whether to overwrite the block list if already exists.
        Returns:
        The properties of the block blob

      • commitBlockList

        public com.azure.android.core.http.ServiceCall commitBlockList(java.lang.String containerName,

                                                               boolean overwrite,

        The Commit Block List operation writes a blob by specifying the list of block IDs that make up the blob. You can call commit Block List to update a blob by uploading only those blocks that have changed, then committing the new and existing blocks together. You can do this by specifying whether to commit a block from the committed block list or from the uncommitted block list, or to commit the most recently uploaded version of the block, whichever list it may belong to.
        Parameters:

      • commitBlockListWithRestResponse

        public BlockBlobsCommitBlockListResponse commitBlockListWithRestResponse(java.lang.String containerName,
                                                                         java.lang.String blobName,
                                                                         java.util.List<java.lang.String> base64BlockIds,
                                                                         byte[] contentMD5,
                                                                         byte[] contentCrc64,
                                                                         java.lang.Integer timeout,
                                                                         BlobHttpHeaders blobHttpHeaders,
                                                                         java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> metadata,
                                                                         BlobRequestConditions requestConditions,
                                                                         java.lang.String requestId,
                                                                         CpkInfo cpkInfo,
                                                                         AccessTier tier)
        The Commit Block List operation writes a blob by specifying the list of block IDs that make up the blob. For a block to be written as part of a blob, the block must have been successfully written to the server in a prior stageBlock(String, String, String, byte[], byte[]) operation. You can call commit Block List to update a blob by uploading only those blocks that have changed, then committing the new and existing blocks together. You can do this by specifying whether to commit a block from the committed block list or from the uncommitted block list, or to commit the most recently uploaded version of the block, whichever list it may belong to.
        Parameters:
        containerName - The container name.
        blobName - The blob name.
        base64BlockIds - The block IDs.
        contentMD5 - Specify the transactional md5 for the body, to be validated by the service.
        contentCrc64 - Specify the transactional crc64 for the body, to be validated by the service.
        timeout - The timeout parameter is expressed in seconds. For more information, see <a href="https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/fileservices/setting-timeouts-for-blob-service-operations">Setting Timeouts for Blob Service Operations.</a>.
        blobHttpHeaders - Additional Http headers for this operation.
        metadata - Specifies a user-defined name-value pair associated with the blob.
        requestConditions - BlobRequestConditions.
        requestId - Provides a client-generated, opaque value with a 1 KB character limit that is recorded in the analytics logs when storage analytics logging is enabled.
        cpkInfo - Additional parameters for the operation.
        tier - Indicates the tier to be set on the blob.
        Returns:
        The response object.
